_header: I sing of a maiden that is makeless
Note:
Based partly on 3806; cf. Copley (1962)
XCopley, J. “‘I Syng of a Myden’.” Notes and Queries n.s. 9 [207] (1962): 134-7, 134-7.
Subjects: Virgin Mary, songs in honour of; songs
_description: A song in praise of the Virgin Mary — five couplets

BodBar24.Transcription:
Mayde wyff and moder whas neuer but yeWell may suche a Lady Goddys
                    modyr be
BodBar24.Note:
One couplet in a Latin sermon for the Feast of the Assumption,
                    introduced ‘vnde communiter de eo canitur’.
BodBar24.Editions:
Fletcher,  Alan J. 
             “I Sing of a Maiden: A Fifteenth-Century Sermon Reminiscence.” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 25 [223] (1978): 108: 108.

BLSl2593.First Lines:
I Syng of a myden þat is makeleskyng of alle kynges to here
                    sone che ches…
BLSl2593.Last Lines:
…moder and mayden was never non but chewel may swych a lady
                    godes moder b
